alert.note: Alert for West Side Mountains north of 198 (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 21 at 1:59AM PDT until March 21 at 6:00AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM PDT EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH 11 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Central California below 4,000 feet. * WHEN...From 5 AM PDT early this morning until 11 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall is possible in much of Central California at elevations up to 4000 feet today through Wednesday evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
